      <h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Government_and_politics">Government and politics</span></h2> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Politics_of_Poland" title="Politics of Poland">Politics of Poland</a>
      </div> 
      <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r978413945/mw-parser-output/.tmulti">.mw-parser-output .tmulti .thumbinner{display:flex;flex-direction:column}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .trow{display:flex;flex-direction:row;clear:left;flex-wrap:wrap;width:100%;box-sizing:border-box}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .tsingle{margin:1px;float:left}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .theader{clear:both;font-weight:bold;text-align:center;align-self:center;background-color:transparent;width:100%}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .thumbcaption{background-color:transparent}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .text-align-left{text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .text-align-right{text-align:right}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .text-align-center{text-align:center}@media all and (max-width:720px){.mw-parser-output .tmulti .thumbinner{width:100%!important;box-sizing:border-box;max-width:none!important;align-items:center}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .trow{justify-content:center}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .tsingle{float:none!important;max-width:100%!important;box-sizing:border-box;text-align:center}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .tsingle .thumbcaption{text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .trow>.thumbcaption{text-align:center}}</style>
      <div class="thumb tmulti tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:246px;max-width:246px">
        <div class="trow">
         <div class="tsingle" style="width:115px;max-width:115px">
          <div class="thumbimage">
           <a href="/wiki/File:Prezydent_Rzeczypospolitej_Polskiej_Andrzej_Duda.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Andrzej Sebastian Duda" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Prezydent_Rzeczypospolitej_Polskiej_Andrzej_Duda.jpg/113px-Prezydent_Rzeczypospolitej_Polskiej_Andrzej_Duda.jpg" decoding="async" width="113" height="166" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Prezydent_Rzeczypospolitej_Polskiej_Andrzej_Duda.jpg/170px-Prezydent_Rzeczypospolitej_Polskiej_Andrzej_Duda.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8b/Prezydent_Rzeczypospolitej_Polskiej_Andrzej_Duda.jpg/226px-Prezydent_Rzeczypospolitej_Polskiej_Andrzej_Duda.jpg 2x" data-file-width="915" data-file-height="1348"></a>
          </div>
          <div class="thumbcaption text-align-center">
           <a href="/wiki/Andrzej_Duda" title="Andrzej Duda">Andrzej Duda</a>
           <br><small><a href="/wiki/President_of_Poland" title="President of Poland">President</a></small>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="tsingle" style="width:127px;max-width:127px">
          <div class="thumbimage">
           <a href="/wiki/File:Mateusz_Morawiecki_Prezes_Rady_Ministr%C3%B3w_(cropped).jpg" class="image"><img alt="Mateusz Jakub Morawiecki" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5d/Mateusz_Morawiecki_Prezes_Rady_Ministr%C3%B3w_%28cropped%29.jpg/125px-Mateusz_Morawiecki_Prezes_Rady_Ministr%C3%B3w_%28cropped%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="125" height="166" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5d/Mateusz_Morawiecki_Prezes_Rady_Ministr%C3%B3w_%28cropped%29.jpg/188px-Mateusz_Morawiecki_Prezes_Rady_Ministr%C3%B3w_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5d/Mateusz_Morawiecki_Prezes_Rady_Ministr%C3%B3w_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Mateusz_Morawiecki_Prezes_Rady_Ministr%C3%B3w_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1899" data-file-height="2528"></a>
          </div>
          <div class="thumbcaption text-align-center">
           <a href="/wiki/Mateusz_Morawiecki" title="Mateusz Morawiecki">Mateusz Morawiecki</a>
           <br><small><a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Poland" title="Prime Minister of Poland">Prime Minister</a></small>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Poland is a <a href="/wiki/Representative_democracy" title="Representative democracy">representative democracy</a>, with a <a href="/wiki/President_of_the_Republic_of_Poland" class="mw-redirect" title="President of the Republic of Poland">president</a> as the <a href="/wiki/Head_of_state" title="Head of state">head of state</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-168" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-168">[160]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-169" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-169">[161]</a></sup> The government structure centers on the <a href="/wiki/Council_of_Ministers_of_the_Republic_of_Poland" class="mw-redirect" title="Council of Ministers of the Republic of Poland">Council of Ministers</a>, led by a <a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_Republic_of_Poland" class="mw-redirect" title="Prime Minister of the Republic of Poland">prime minister</a>. The president appoints the cabinet according to the proposals of the prime minister, typically from the majority coalition in the <a href="/wiki/Sejm_of_the_Republic_of_Poland" class="mw-redirect" title="Sejm of the Republic of Poland">Sejm</a>. The president is elected by popular vote every five years. The current <a href="/wiki/President_of_the_Republic_of_Poland" class="mw-redirect" title="President of the Republic of Poland">president</a> is <a href="/wiki/Andrzej_Duda" title="Andrzej Duda">Andrzej Duda</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Poland" title="Prime Minister of Poland">prime minister</a> is <a href="/wiki/Mateusz_Morawiecki" title="Mateusz Morawiecki">Mateusz Morawiecki</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-170" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-170">[162]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Polish voters elect a <a href="/wiki/Bicameralism" title="Bicameralism">bicameral</a> parliament consisting of a 460-member lower house (Sejm) and a 100-member Senate (<a href="/wiki/Senate_of_the_Republic_of_Poland" class="mw-redirect" title="Senate of the Republic of Poland">Senat</a>). The Sejm is elected under <a href="/wiki/Proportional_representation" title="Proportional representation">proportional representation</a> according to the <a href="/wiki/D%27Hondt_method" title="D'Hondt method">d'Hondt method</a>, a method similar to that used in many parliamentary political systems. The Senat, on the other hand, is elected under the <a href="/wiki/First-past-the-post_voting" title="First-past-the-post voting">first-past-the-post voting</a> method, with one senator being returned from each of the 100 constituencies.<sup id="cite_ref-171" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-171">[163]</a></sup> </p> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Zgromadzenie_Narodowe_4_czerwca_2014_Kancelaria_Senatu_01.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Zgromadzenie_Narodowe_4_czerwca_2014_Kancelaria_Senatu_01.JPG/220px-Zgromadzenie_Narodowe_4_czerwca_2014_Kancelaria_Senatu_01.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Zgromadzenie_Narodowe_4_czerwca_2014_Kancelaria_Senatu_01.JPG/330px-Zgromadzenie_Narodowe_4_czerwca_2014_Kancelaria_Senatu_01.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Zgromadzenie_Narodowe_4_czerwca_2014_Kancelaria_Senatu_01.JPG/440px-Zgromadzenie_Narodowe_4_czerwca_2014_Kancelaria_Senatu_01.JPG 2x" data-file-width="5616" data-file-height="3744"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Zgromadzenie_Narodowe_4_czerwca_2014_Kancelaria_Senatu_01.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The <a href="/wiki/Sejm" title="Sejm">Sejm</a> is the <a href="/wiki/Lower_house" title="Lower house">lower house</a> of the Polish <a href="/wiki/Parliament" title="Parliament">parliament</a>.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>With the exception of ethnic minority parties, only candidates of <a href="/wiki/List_of_political_parties_in_Poland" title="List of political parties in Poland">political parties</a> receiving at least 5% of the total national vote can enter the Sejm. When sitting in joint session, members of the Sejm and Senat form the <a href="/wiki/National_Assembly_of_the_Republic_of_Poland" class="mw-redirect" title="National Assembly of the Republic of Poland">National Assembly</a> (the <i>Zgromadzenie Narodowe</i>). The National Assembly is formed on three occasions: when a new president takes the <a href="/wiki/Oath_of_office" title="Oath of office">oath of office</a>; when an indictment against the President of the Republic is brought to the State Tribunal (<i>Trybunał Stanu</i>); and when a president's permanent incapacity to exercise his duties due to the state of his health is declared. To date only the first instance has occurred.<sup id="cite_ref-172" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-172">[164]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Judiciary" title="Judiciary">judicial branch</a> plays an important role in decision-making. Its major institutions include the <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_Poland" title="Supreme Court of Poland">Supreme Court</a> (<i>Sąd Najwyższy</i>); the <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Administrative_Court_of_Poland" title="Supreme Administrative Court of Poland">Supreme Administrative Court</a> (<i>Naczelny Sąd Administracyjny</i>); the <a href="/wiki/Constitutional_Tribunal_of_Poland" class="mw-redirect" title="Constitutional Tribunal of Poland">Constitutional Tribunal</a> (<i>Trybunał Konstytucyjny</i>); and the <a href="/wiki/State_Tribunal_(Poland)" title="State Tribunal (Poland)">State Tribunal</a> (<i>Trybunał Stanu</i>). On the approval of the Senat, the Sejm also appoints the <a href="/wiki/Polish_Ombudsman" title="Polish Ombudsman">ombudsman</a> or the Commissioner for Civil Rights Protection (<i>Rzecznik Praw Obywatelskich</i>) for a five-year term. The ombudsman has the duty of guarding the observance and implementation of the rights and liberties of Polish citizens and residents, of the law and of principles of community life and social justice.<sup id="cite_ref-173" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-173">[165]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Law">Law</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Law_of_Poland" title="Law of Poland">Law of Poland</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Manuscript_of_the_Constitution_of_the_3rd_May_1791.PNG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9d/Manuscript_of_the_Constitution_of_the_3rd_May_1791.PNG/170px-Manuscript_of_the_Constitution_of_the_3rd_May_1791.PNG" decoding="async" width="170" height="258" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9d/Manuscript_of_the_Constitution_of_the_3rd_May_1791.PNG/255px-Manuscript_of_the_Constitution_of_the_3rd_May_1791.PNG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9d/Manuscript_of_the_Constitution_of_the_3rd_May_1791.PNG/340px-Manuscript_of_the_Constitution_of_the_3rd_May_1791.PNG 2x" data-file-width="554" data-file-height="842"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Manuscript_of_the_Constitution_of_the_3rd_May_1791.PNG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_May_3,_1791" class="mw-redirect" title="Constitution of May 3, 1791"><i>Constitution of 3 May</i></a> adopted in 1791 was the first modern constitution in Europe.<sup id="cite_ref-Davies_699_174-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Davies_699-174">[166]</a></sup>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Poland" title="Constitution of Poland">Constitution of Poland</a> is the enacted supreme law, and the Polish legal system is based on the principle of civil rights, governed by the code of <a href="/wiki/Civil_law_(legal_system)" title="Civil law (legal system)">civil law</a>. The current <a href="/wiki/Democracy" title="Democracy">democratic</a> constitution was adopted by the <a href="/wiki/National_Assembly_of_Poland" class="mw-redirect" title="National Assembly of Poland">National Assembly of Poland</a> on 2 April 1997; it guarantees a <a href="/wiki/Multi-party_state" class="mw-redirect" title="Multi-party state">multi-party state</a> with freedoms of religion, speech and assembly, prohibits the practices of forced <a href="/wiki/Medical_experimentation" class="mw-redirect" title="Medical experimentation">medical experimentation</a>, torture or <a href="/wiki/Corporal_punishment" title="Corporal punishment">corporal punishment</a>, and acknowledges the inviolability of the home, the right to form <a href="/wiki/Trade_union" title="Trade union">trade unions</a>, and the right to <a href="/wiki/Strike_action" title="Strike action">strike</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-175" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-175">[167]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>The <a href="/wiki/Judiciary_of_Poland" title="Judiciary of Poland">judiciary</a> incorporates a four-tier court system composed of the <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_Poland" title="Supreme Court of Poland">Supreme Court</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Administrative_Court_of_Poland" title="Supreme Administrative Court of Poland">Supreme Administrative Court</a>, Common Courts (<a href="/wiki/District_Court" class="mw-redirect" title="District Court">District</a>, <a href="/wiki/Regional_Court_(Poland)" class="mw-redirect" title="Regional Court (Poland)">Regional</a>, <a href="/wiki/Appellate_court" title="Appellate court">Appellate</a>) and the <a href="/wiki/Court-martial" title="Court-martial">Military Court</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-176" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-176">[168]</a></sup> Judges are nominated by the <a href="/wiki/National_Council_of_the_Judiciary" title="National Council of the Judiciary">National Council of the Judiciary</a> and are appointed for life by the <a href="/wiki/President_of_Poland" title="President of Poland">president</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-177" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-177">[169]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Constitutional_Tribunal_(Poland)" title="Constitutional Tribunal (Poland)">Constitutional</a> and <a href="/wiki/State_Tribunal_(Poland)" title="State Tribunal (Poland)">State Tribunals</a> are separate judicial bodies, which rule the constitutional liability of people holding the highest offices of state and supervise the compliance of <a href="/wiki/Statutory_law" title="Statutory law">statutory law</a>, thus protecting the Constitution.<sup id="cite_ref-178" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-178">[170]</a></sup> </p> 
      <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r978413945/mw-parser-output/.tmulti">
      <div class="thumb tmulti tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:204px;max-width:204px">
        <div class="trow">
         <div class="tsingle" style="width:202px;max-width:202px">
          <div class="thumbimage">
           <a href="/wiki/File:Wielka_sala_rozpraw_Trybuna%C5%82u_Konstytucyjnego_2016_03.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Wielka_sala_rozpraw_Trybuna%C5%82u_Konstytucyjnego_2016_03.JPG/200px-Wielka_sala_rozpraw_Trybuna%C5%82u_Konstytucyjnego_2016_03.JPG" decoding="async" width="200" height="117" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Wielka_sala_rozpraw_Trybuna%C5%82u_Konstytucyjnego_2016_03.JPG/300px-Wielka_sala_rozpraw_Trybuna%C5%82u_Konstytucyjnego_2016_03.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Wielka_sala_rozpraw_Trybuna%C5%82u_Konstytucyjnego_2016_03.JPG/400px-Wielka_sala_rozpraw_Trybuna%C5%82u_Konstytucyjnego_2016_03.JPG 2x" data-file-width="4631" data-file-height="2704"></a>
          </div>
          <div class="thumbcaption">
           The <a href="/wiki/Constitutional_Tribunal_(Poland)" title="Constitutional Tribunal (Poland)">Polish Constitutional Tribunal</a>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="trow">
         <div class="tsingle" style="width:202px;max-width:202px">
          <div class="thumbimage">
           <a href="/wiki/File:S%C4%85d_najwy%C5%BCszy_s2.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/S%C4%85d_najwy%C5%BCszy_s2.jpg/200px-S%C4%85d_najwy%C5%BCszy_s2.jpg" decoding="async" width="200" height="133" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/S%C4%85d_najwy%C5%BCszy_s2.jpg/300px-S%C4%85d_najwy%C5%BCszy_s2.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/31/S%C4%85d_najwy%C5%BCszy_s2.jpg/400px-S%C4%85d_najwy%C5%BCszy_s2.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2662" data-file-height="1774"></a>
          </div>
          <div class="thumbcaption">
           The <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_Poland" title="Supreme Court of Poland">Supreme Court of Poland</a>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Historically, the most significant Polish legal act is the <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_3_May_1791" title="Constitution of 3 May 1791">Constitution of 3 May 1791</a>, the first modern constitution in Europe.<sup id="cite_ref-Davies_699_174-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Davies_699-174">[166]</a></sup> Instituted as a <a href="/wiki/Government_Act" class="mw-redirect" title="Government Act">Government Act</a>, it was designed to redress long-standing political defects of the <a href="/wiki/Federation" title="Federation">federative</a> <a href="/wiki/Polish%E2%80%93Lithuanian_Commonwealth" title="Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth">Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth</a> and its <a href="/wiki/Golden_Liberty" title="Golden Liberty">Golden Liberty</a>. Previously, only the <a href="/wiki/Henrician_Articles" title="Henrician Articles">Henrician Articles</a> (1573) signed by each of Poland's elected monarchs could perform the function of a set of basic laws. The new Constitution introduced political equality between <a href="/wiki/Townspeople" class="mw-redirect" title="Townspeople">townspeople</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Nobility" title="Nobility">nobility</a> (<i><a href="/wiki/Szlachta" title="Szlachta">szlachta</a></i>), and placed the <a href="/wiki/Peasant" title="Peasant">peasants</a> under the protection of the government. It abolished pernicious parliamentary policies such as the <i><a href="/wiki/Liberum_veto" title="Liberum veto">liberum veto</a></i>, which permitted any deputy to rescind all the legislation passed in the interest of a foreign power. The 3 May Constitution sought to supplant the existing anarchy fostered by some of the country's <a href="/wiki/Reactionary" title="Reactionary">reactionary</a> <a href="/wiki/Magnate" title="Magnate">magnates</a>, with a more <a href="/wiki/Egalitarianism" title="Egalitarianism">egalitarian</a> and democratic <a href="/wiki/Constitutional_monarchy" title="Constitutional monarchy">constitutional monarchy</a>. The <a href="https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Constitution_of_3_May_1791" class="extiw" title="wikisource:Constitution of 3 May 1791">Constitution</a> influenced many later <a href="/wiki/Democratic_movement" class="mw-redirect" title="Democratic movement">democratic movements</a> across the globe.<sup id="cite_ref-179" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-179">[171]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-180" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-180">[172]</a></sup> Tax-paying women were allowed to take part in Polish political life until the <a href="/wiki/Third_Partition_of_Poland" title="Third Partition of Poland">third partition</a> in 1795. In 1918 the <a href="/wiki/Second_Polish_Republic" title="Second Polish Republic">Second Polish Republic</a> became one of the first countries to introduce universal <a href="/wiki/Women%27s_suffrage" title="Women's suffrage">women's suffrage</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-181" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-181">[173]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Poland has a low <a href="/wiki/Homicide" title="Homicide">homicide</a> rate at 0.7 murders per 100,000 people, as of 2018.<sup id="cite_ref-182" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-182">[174]</a></sup> Rape, assault and violent crime remain at a very low level.<sup id="cite_ref-183" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-183">[175]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-184" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-184">[176]</a></sup> </p>
      <p><a href="/wiki/Abortion" title="Abortion">Abortion</a> is permitted only in cases of rape, incest or when the woman’s life is in danger.<sup id="cite_ref-185" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-185">[177]</a></sup> Poland does not criminalize <a href="/wiki/Homosexuality" title="Homosexuality">homosexuality</a>, and its legality was confirmed in 1932.<sup id="cite_ref-186" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-186">[178]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-187" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-187">[179]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Poland" title="Constitution of Poland">Polish Constitution</a> defines <a href="/wiki/Marriage" title="Marriage">marriage</a> as a union between a <a href="/wiki/Man" title="Man">man</a> and a <a href="/wiki/Woman" title="Woman">woman</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-188" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-188">[180]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Foreign_relations">Foreign relations</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_Poland" title="Foreign relations of Poland">Foreign relations of Poland</a> and <a href="/wiki/List_of_diplomatic_missions_of_Poland" title="List of diplomatic missions of Poland">List of diplomatic missions of Poland</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Ministerstwo_Spraw_Zagraniczych_al._Szucha_23.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/Ministerstwo_Spraw_Zagraniczych_al._Szucha_23.JPG/220px-Ministerstwo_Spraw_Zagraniczych_al._Szucha_23.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="159" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/Ministerstwo_Spraw_Zagraniczych_al._Szucha_23.JPG/330px-Ministerstwo_Spraw_Zagraniczych_al._Szucha_23.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/Ministerstwo_Spraw_Zagraniczych_al._Szucha_23.JPG/440px-Ministerstwo_Spraw_Zagraniczych_al._Szucha_23.JPG 2x" data-file-width="4095" data-file-height="2958"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Ministerstwo_Spraw_Zagraniczych_al._Szucha_23.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>The <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Poland)" title="Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Poland)">Ministry of Foreign Affairs</a>, located in <a href="/wiki/Warsaw" title="Warsaw">Warsaw</a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Poland is the <a href="/wiki/List_of_European_Union_member_states_by_population" title="List of European Union member states by population">fifth most populous member state</a> of the European Union and has a grand total of 52 representatives in the <a href="/wiki/European_Parliament" title="European Parliament">European Parliament</a> as of 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-189" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-189">[181]</a></sup> Since joining the union in 2004, successive Polish governments have pursued policies to extend the country's role in European and international affairs. Poland is an important hub for international relations and a regional power in Central Europe, with the largest economy of the <a href="/wiki/Three_Seas_Initiative" title="Three Seas Initiative">Three Seas Initiative</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-190" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-190">[182]</a></sup> The capital of <a href="/wiki/Warsaw" title="Warsaw">Warsaw</a> serves as the headquarters for <a href="/wiki/Frontex" class="mw-redirect" title="Frontex">Frontex</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-191" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-191">[183]</a></sup> the European Union's agency for external border security as well as <a href="/wiki/ODIHR" class="mw-redirect" title="ODIHR">ODIHR</a>, one of the principal institutions of the <a href="/wiki/Organization_for_Security_and_Cooperation_in_Europe" class="mw-redirect" title="Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe">Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-192" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-192">[184]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Apart from the European Union, Poland has been a member of <a href="/wiki/NATO" title="NATO">NATO</a> since 1999, the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">UN</a>, the <a href="/wiki/World_Trade_Organization" title="World Trade Organization">World Trade Organization</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Organisation_for_Economic_Co-operation_and_Development" class="mw-redirect" title="Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development">Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development</a> (OECD) since 1996, <a href="/wiki/European_Economic_Area" title="European Economic Area">European Economic Area</a>, <a href="/wiki/International_Energy_Agency" title="International Energy Agency">International Energy Agency</a>, <a href="/wiki/Council_of_Europe" title="Council of Europe">Council of Europe</a>, <a href="/wiki/Organization_for_Security_and_Co-operation_in_Europe" title="Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe">Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe</a>, <a href="/wiki/International_Atomic_Energy_Agency" title="International Atomic Energy Agency">International Atomic Energy Agency</a>, <a href="/wiki/European_Space_Agency" title="European Space Agency">European Space Agency</a>, <a href="/wiki/G6_(EU)" title="G6 (EU)">G6</a>, <a href="/wiki/Council_of_the_Baltic_Sea_States" title="Council of the Baltic Sea States">Council of the Baltic Sea States</a>, <a href="/wiki/Visegr%C3%A1d_Group" title="Visegrád Group">Visegrád Group</a>, <a href="/wiki/Weimar_Triangle" title="Weimar Triangle">Weimar Triangle</a> and <a href="/wiki/Schengen_Agreement" title="Schengen Agreement">Schengen Agreement</a>. </p>
      <p>Over the past two decades, Poland significantly strengthened its ties with the <a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">United States</a>, thus becoming one of its closest <a href="/wiki/Alliance" title="Alliance">allies</a> in Europe.<sup id="cite_ref-193" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-193">[185]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-194" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-194">[186]</a></sup> Poland was part of the <a href="/wiki/Multi-National_Force_%E2%80%93_Iraq" title="Multi-National Force – Iraq">US-led coalition force</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Iraq_War" title="Iraq War">Iraq War</a> in 2003, and <a href="/wiki/Polish_involvement_in_the_2003_invasion_of_Iraq" title="Polish involvement in the 2003 invasion of Iraq">sent its troops</a> in the first phase of the conflict, jointly with the <a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom" title="United Kingdom">United Kingdom</a> and <a href="/wiki/Australia" title="Australia">Australia</a>. In recent years, Poland also sought to become a <a href="/wiki/Mediation" title="Mediation">mediator</a> between the <a href="/wiki/Trump_administration" class="mw-redirect" title="Trump administration">Trump administration</a> and the European Union in solving European disputes.<sup id="cite_ref-195" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-195">[187]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-196" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-196">[188]</a></sup> Along with NATO, Poland maintains military presence in the <a href="/wiki/Middle_East" title="Middle East">Middle East</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Baltic_states" title="Baltic states">Baltic states</a> and in the <a href="/wiki/Balkans" title="Balkans">Balkans</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-197" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-197">[189]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-198" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-198">[190]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Administrative_divisions">Administrative divisions</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Administrative_divisions_of_Poland" title="Administrative divisions of Poland">Administrative divisions of Poland</a>
      </div> 
      <p>Poland's current <a href="/wiki/Voivodeships_of_Poland" title="Voivodeships of Poland">voivodeships</a> (provinces) are largely based on the country's historic regions, whereas those of the past two decades (to 1998) had been centred on and named for individual cities. The new units range in area from less than 10,000 square kilometres (3,900&nbsp;sq&nbsp;mi) for Opole Voivodeship to more than 35,000 square kilometres (14,000&nbsp;sq&nbsp;mi) for Masovian Voivodeship. Administrative authority at voivodeship level is shared between a government-appointed <a href="/wiki/Voivode" title="Voivode">voivode</a> (governor), an elected regional assembly (<i><a href="/wiki/Voivodeship_sejmik" title="Voivodeship sejmik">sejmik</a></i>) and a voivodeship marshal, an executive elected by that assembly. </p>
      <p>The voivodeships are subdivided into <i><a href="/wiki/Powiat" title="Powiat">powiats</a></i> (often referred to in English as counties), and these are further divided into <i><a href="/wiki/Gmina" title="Gmina">gminas</a></i> (also known as communes or municipalities). Major cities normally have the status of both <i>gmina</i> and <i>powiat</i>. Poland has 16 voivodeships, 380 powiats (including 66 cities with <i>powiat</i> status), and 2,478 <i>gminas</i>. </p> 
      <table style="background:none;"> 
       <tbody>
        <tr> 
         <td> 
          <div role="img" class="floatleft noresize" style="width: 400px; padding: 15px; line-height: 1; text-align: center; background-color: #ffffff; position: relative;">

           <div style="position:absolute; font-size:85%; left:238px; top:80px">
            <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Warmian-Masurian_Voivodeship" title="Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship"><img alt="Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/de/POL_wojew%C3%B3dztwo_warmi%C5%84sko-mazurskie_flag.svg/23px-POL_wojew%C3%B3dztwo_warmi%C5%84sko-mazurskie_flag.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="12" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/de/POL_wojew%C3%B3dztwo_warmi%C5%84sko-mazurskie_flag.svg/35px-POL_wojew%C3%B3dztwo_warmi%C5%84sko-mazurskie_flag.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/de/POL_wojew%C3%B3dztwo_warmi%C5%84sko-mazurskie_flag.svg/46px-POL_wojew%C3%B3dztwo_warmi%C5%84sko-mazurskie_flag.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1000" data-file-height="500"></a></span>

           </div>
